intro: Tupa secunda, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of down. Tupa secunda is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its traditional uses in local medicine.
